intro: Veratrum maackii var. longebracteatum, commonly known as the long-bract veratrum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant features large, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale green flowers that bloom in summer. Its berries are typically red or black and contain toxic compounds, making it a plant with both ecological and medicinal significance. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided by livestock and requires careful handling.
